title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Cyient, CNH expand autonomous equipment partnership
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Cyient and CNH Construction Equipment expanded their partnership to accelerate *perception* and *automation technologies* across multiple vehicle platforms.
- The program delivered the **Advanced Perception System** for wheel loaders, showcased at Bauma, a milestone toward autonomous construction machinery.
- Leaders from CNH and Cyient vow to co-create next-generation solutions that scale *autonomy* across segments, boosting safety, efficiency and productivity.

items.title: Tembo Global to raise Tembo Defence stake to 75%
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Tembo Global approved up to *₹126.71 crore* investment in Tembo Defence Products, lifting its stake to *75%* and making it a subsidiary.\n- The move, approved at the Board on Nov 26, 2025, strengthens Tembo’s presence in *defence manufacturing* and aligns with *national priorities* in India’s defence ecosystem.\n- MD *Sanjay J Patel* says the investment demonstrates sector confidence and aims to drive *innovation*, quality and value for stakeholders.

items.title: Safran to fully transfer engine tech to India: CEO
items.summary:
- Safran, backed by French government support, is **committed to full engine technology transfer** to *India* for the next fighter engine. 
- Andries said India would be the only country where Safran would do so, with DRDO engagement on technical and commercial co-development and Hyderabad MRO facilities for LEAP and M88 engines. 
- Safran also plans to set up a final assembly line in India for Rafale engines and critical components if orders for the fighter jets grow.

items.title: Tata Power to build 10-GW ingots & wafers plant in Odisha
items.summary: - Tata Power plans to set up a 10-GW ingots and wafers facility in Odisha with an investment of ₹10,000 crore, to *backward integrate* into solar cells and panels. - The project targets both domestic use and export markets and would leverage its existing **4.55 GW** cell-and-module capacity. - Location options include *Gopalpur* (Ganjam district) and *Cuttack*, chosen for proximity to ports.

items.title: L&T among top Nifty50 gainers after ₹4,131
items.summary: - **Larsen & Toubro** rose in early trade to about ₹4,131.3, up as much as 1.71%.\n- The rally is driven by *robust order inflows*, strong revenue growth, and a *favorable broker outlook* recommending a buy.\n- **Motilal Oswal Securities** reiterated a bullish stance citing strong fundamentals and sector tailwinds.

items.title: PM Modi unveils Vikram-I, India’s largest orbital rocket
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- PM Modi virtually launched Skyroot Aerospace's *Vikram-I*, India's first private orbital rocket, and inaugurated the Infinity Campus in Hyderabad for end-to-end development, integration, and testing of launch vehicles. 
- Vikram-I is a multi-stage launch vehicle with an all-carbon-fibre body and **3D-printed liquid engines**, capable of placing about 300 kg into *low Earth orbit*, and can be assembled and launch-ready within 24 hours from any site. 
- The PM described it as a significant leap for India’s space sector and said India will emerge as a global leader in the *satellite launch ecosystem*.

items.title: Auto industry hails Cabinet’s ₹7,280-crore push for domestic rare earth magnet manufacturing
Krutrim’s semicon team exits loom over chip plans
US group sues Apple over Congo conflict minerals
Nvidia rebuts critics in memo to analysts amid pushback campaign
Trump team wants Taiwan to train US chip plant workers
Mexico plans Latin America’s biggest supercomputer
items.summary:
- **Coatlicue**, a *public* supercomputer, will reach **314 petaflops** to aid *climate*, crop planning, water and energy projects.
- Construction starts January, lasts 24 months, at about **6 billion pesos** (~$326.6M).
- It aims to boost science and entrepreneurship, competing with exascale rivals like **El Capitan** and **Jupiter**.

items.title: Pexpo targets ₹250cr rev in FY25 on 10x growth
items.author: ETRetail Desk
items.summary: - *Pexpo* targets ₹250 crore revenue in FY25 after a six‑year 10x growth from ₹20 crore in 2020 to ₹180 crore in 2024.\n- Growth is driven by *product innovation*, *manufacturing expansion*, and rising demand for plastic alternatives.\n- The brand’s step on anti‑dumping duty against Chinese vacuum flasks supports domestic manufacturing and aligns with *Make in India* and *Aatmanirbhar Bharat*.

items.title: Andhra keen to create ecosystem for small, medium enterprise units: Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
Cosmic PV Power Ltd expands into the IPP market by securing ₹600 crore solar modules supply order from Zetwerk
Tamil Nadu signs 158 MoUs for ₹43,844 cr, inks pact for 2-seater trainer aircraft manufacturing unit
Japan unions target ¥12k monthly base pay hike next year
items.summary:
- The *Japan Council of Metalworkers' Unions* (JCM) is seeking at least *¥12,000* more in monthly base pay for next year, matching this year's target.
- The move comes as *Rengo*, Japan's largest labor confederation, calls for at least *5%* total wage rise in 2026, including a base pay increase of at least *3%*.
- According to Rengo, member unions achieved an average pay rise of *5.25%* this year, the biggest in *34 years*.

items.title: India must become a world manufacturer, say industry leaders
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- *India must become the world's manufacturing hub*, with **competitiveness** and *sustainability* driving the next phase of growth.
- Jamshyd Godrej emphasized that India has progressed but still faces a long path to become a **manufacturer to the world**.
- P. Anbalagan highlighted Maharashtra's goal of a **USD 1 trillion economy by 2030**, aiming for two-digit growth and attracting **USD 500 billion** in investment plus up to 10 million MSME units.

items.title: Alstom marks a decade at Madhepura JV; WAG-12B hits 550
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *Alstom* marked the tenth anniversary of the Madhepura Electric Locomotive Pvt. Ltd. (MELPL) JV with more than *550* WAG-12B locomotives delivered.\n- The WAG-12B locomotives deliver *12,000 HP* and can haul *6,000 tonnes* at *120 km/h*, with depots at Saharanpur and Nagpur as support.\n- The milestone underscores a growing domestic supply chain and jobs across 21 villages in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.

items.title: Diageo India cuts GHG 93%, surpasses renewables target
items.summary:
- **Diageo India’s United Spirits** cut greenhouse gas emissions by **93%** since 2020 and now uses **99% renewable energy**, well ahead of its **2030 target**. 
- **54%** improvement in water-use efficiency at distilleries and **35%** at packaging sites since 2020; FY25 replenished **182,000 m³** with a cumulative total of **11 lakh m³**; coal phased out in 2022 with zero waste to landfill and **99% recyclable packaging**. 
- Social impact and governance: leadership diversity toward a **50%** target, skilling **1,922** people (67% women, **303** with disabilities); outreach via Act Smart India (**2 lakh** youth) and DRINKiQ (**5 lakh**), plus Bar Academy training over **9,400** bartenders.

items.title: India's green economy may attract $4.1 trillion investments, create 48 million jobs: Study
Indrajaal launches India's first mobile anti-drone vehicle
items.summary:
- The *Indrajaal Ranger* ADPV is India’s first *mobile, AI-enabled counter-drone system* that detects, tracks and neutralises hostile drones along the borders. 
- Built on a 4×4 chassis with SkyOS autonomy, it offers up to *10 km* drone detection and up to *4 km* mitigation, backed by AI threat assessment and options like *cyber takeover*, **soft-kill**, and interceptor drones. 
- Aimed at *border security forces* and police to curb drone-based smuggling of drugs and weapons, it marks Indrajaal’s response to a new battlefield, per founder *Kiran Raju*.

items.title: Vipul Organics announces foray into membrane manufacturing, expands capacity with new Sayakha plant
Thermax TBWES wins ₹580 crore Dangote order
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *TBWES* won an order worth over ₹580 crore from **Dangote Industries** for the refinery and petrochemical complex in **Nigeria**, including four 400 TPH high‑pressure boilers.
- *TBWES* will manage project execution, engineering, procurement, manufacturing, plug‑and‑play boiler modules, and supervision of construction and commissioning.
- This marks a continued partnership with **Dangote Industries**; Thermax previously supplied boilers and HRSGs for the Lekki refinery project in 2017 and has supported installation and modernization since.

items.title: Mirana Toys raises ₹57.5 crore in Series A funding
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Series A led by *Arkam Ventures*, with *Accel*, *Info Edge* and *Riverwalk Holdings*, to fund a factory with injection-moulding, die-casting and in-house packaging to scale production.\n- Founded in 2021 by Devansh Sharma and Ravi Yadav, Mirana uses a vertically integrated model for design, electronics, tooling and assembly, with products like *AI-enabled robots* and STEM kits.\n- US exports ~40% of demand; Mirana targets growth in the Middle East and Africa as India’s tech-toys market nears $6.95B by 2034 (12.5% CAGR).

items.title: Zetwerk names Jai Shankar Krishnan as Independent Director
items.summary:
- Zetwerk names *Jai Shankar Krishnan* as an independent director to support its **global expansion**.
- Krishnan brings over three decades in **industrial manufacturing**, with roles at Hindustan Unilever, GlaxoSmithKline, Novartis and Danaher.
- Zetwerk says his experience with the **Danaher Business System** will aid **operational systems**, acquisitions and growth.

items.title: BC Jindal signs PPA with SECI for 150 MW RTC
items.summary:
- **PPA** with **SECI** for a **150 MW round-the-clock** project, part of SECI’s **1,200 MW RTC** tender.
- The capacity was won through **competitive bidding** at a tariff of **₹5.07 per kWh** in a reverse auction.
- The group has reached **750 MW** of renewable projects since FY25 and will deploy **ISTS-connected solar, wind and storage** under the PPA.

items.title: Modi inaugurates Safran MRO in Hyderabad
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *PM Modi* virtually inaugurated Safran Aircraft Engine Services India (SAESI) in Hyderabad, marking a milestone for domestic *MRO* capacity.
- The 45,000 sq m facility, with an initial investment of ₹1,300 crore, aims to service up to 300 LEAP engines annually and employ over 1,000 Indian engineers.
- Officials say expanding MRO capacity will boost *atmanirbharata*, reduce foreign exchange outflow, and strengthen India's aviation supply chain through domestic production.

items.title: SoftBank buys Ampere Computing to accelerate AI push
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary: - **SoftBank completes the acquisition of Ampere Computing**, making Ampere a wholly owned subsidiary with its finances consolidated into SoftBank’s results.\n- *Ampere* is known for **Arm-based processors** and targets **cloud workloads**, **AI apps**, and **high-performance computing**, strengthening SoftBank’s *AI computing push* and **data-centre infrastructure**.\n- Founded in 2017 in Santa Clara, Ampere positions itself as a challenger in the server processor market, emphasizing performance-per-watt and cloud-native scalability.

items.title: Vikram Solar launches 5 GW plant in Tamil Nadu, 9.5 GW cap
items.summary:
- **Vikram Solar** commissioned a 5 GW solar module plant at **Vallam, Tamil Nadu**, boosting total capacity to **9.5 GW**.
- The 27,000 sq m, fully automated facility uses robotics and **TOPCon** tech and is ready for upgrades to **HJT**, delivering higher module quality and faster timelines.
- Vallam expands **Vikram Solar**’s Tamil Nadu footprint, serving utility-scale, C&I and distributed generation nationwide, strengthening India’s solar value chain.

items.title: Parliament panel seeks uniform safety protocol for SAIL
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - The parliamentary standing committee called for *uniform safety protocols* across permanent and contract workers at **SAIL** during its review of the company’s structure and performance. - It emphasised *industrial safety standards*, *labour welfare*, and compliance with the four new labour codes that consolidate 29 laws. - Officials noted SAIL’s plants—Bokaro, Bhilai, and Rourkela—along with expansion plans and a decarbonisation roadmap, and cited the company’s half-year results (₹1,112 crore profit; ₹52,600 crore revenue).

items.title: Rajnath Singh urges global partners to co-develop maritime capabilities with India’s shipyards
Titagarh Rail plans to foray into wagon leasing business
TSMC sues ex-exec over trade secrets, Intel move
items.author: AFP
items.summary:
- **TSMC** has filed a lawsuit against former executive *Lo Wei-jen* alleging leakage of **trade secrets** to **Intel**.
- Lo Wei-jen retired in July and allegedly met with staff to understand advanced technologies currently under development at TSMC.
- The case, lodged in the Intellectual Property and Commercial Court, relies on non-compete and NDA agreements and may involve the **National Security Act**.

items.title: Spain to invest $868M in Diamond Foundry chip plant
items.summary:
- The *Spanish government* will invest 753 million euros ($868 million) in a Diamond Foundry chip plant in *Trujillo* to expand microchip manufacturing.
- The project aims to produce synthetic *diamond wafers* to improve heat dissipation and address chip overheating, a major industry bottleneck.
- *Diamond Foundry*, backed by Leonardo DiCaprio, plans further investment and runs existing facilities, signaling Europe’s push into diamond-based semiconductors.

items.title: HP to cut 6,000 jobs by 2028 as AI push grows
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- HP Inc plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 jobs globally by fiscal 2028 to streamline operations and accelerate **AI** adoption.
- The cuts will affect product development, internal operations, and customer support, with CEO Enrique Lores saying the move could deliver **$1 billion** in gross run-rate savings over three years.
- HP remains a top PC vendor and has benefited from demand for **AI-enabled PCs**, but rising memory-chip costs could pressure margins.

items.title: Zetwerk hires banks for IPO filing next year
items.summary:
- Zetwerk has hired banks to file its **IPO** papers in March 2026, led by **Kotak Mahindra Capital**, **Morgan Stanley**, **Avendus**, **Goldman Sachs**, **JM Financial** and **HSBC**.
- The listing could raise up to **$750 million**, with valuation work under way and **Bloomberg** reporting the plan.
- Zetwerk serves 3,500+ customers including Tata Steel, Mitsubishi and Honeywell, and recently raised nearly **$90 million** at a **$3.1B** valuation.

items.title: Semicon supply chains are in constant flux on tariffs, policy swings: Pure Storage CEO
Qatar's Ooredoo plans $500 million investment on cable projects
items.summary: - Ooredoo plans to invest more than *$500 million* in new international cable projects, reshaping routes across Oman, Iraq, Turkey and Europe.\n- CEO Aziz Aluthman Fakhroo says the system will *enhance global network flexibility*, create alternative routes that bypass the Red Sea and the *Strait of Hormuz*, and place the region at the heart of the international data network.\n- This strategy comes amid subsea cable outages and connectivity disruptions in the Gulf, with Ooredoo operating across the *Middle East, North Africa and Southeast Asia*.

items.title: ₹1,500cr mineral recycling scheme draws interest
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - The Centre's ₹1,500 crore Incentive Scheme for *Critical Mineral Recycling* is drawing strong early interest, with many entities registering on the application portal. - Mines Secretary Piyush Goyal reviewed progress alongside JNARDDC, the PMA, and linked the scheme to the *National Critical Mineral Mission* with registrations open from Oct 2, 2025 to Apr 1, 2026. - The scheme aims to build recycling capacity from secondary sources such as *e-waste* and *spent lithium-ion batteries*, with workshops and a helpdesk to support participants.

items.title: Marelli to accelerate automotive electronics development with new Bengaluru R&D facility
Zscaler tops quarterly estimates on strong cybersecurity demand
Pharma industry must shift to innovative products
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The pharma industry must move from post-patent launches to **R&D‑driven innovation**, expanding into *complex generics*, peptides, biosimilars, and biologics. 
- India aims to stay the *pharmacy of the world* by boosting exports while overhauling the pharmacy curriculum to cover the full value chain, from discovery to scalable manufacture. 
- Leaders call for *innovators, not just launchers*, as CPHI/PMEC India fosters faster collaboration and a stronger innovation wave.

items.title: Employment in unincorporated sector rises marginally to 12.85 cr in Jul-Sep quarter: Govt survey
Landlocked states to receive focused support under export promotion mission: Goyal
Vedanta poised for 16% annual growth in pre-tax earnings through FY28 on volume ramp-up: Report
India’s mega projects need a productivity leap – mechanisation and digitalisation can deliver it
Titan Intech, MIC to localise Indian display tech
items.summary:
- Titan Intech teams up with MIC to co-develop and localise LED/SMD/MiP/Mini-LED and LCD control systems in India, boosting *import substitution* and self-reliance.
- The seven-year deal covers about ₹135 crore for tech absorption, infra expansion and local production, with MIC providing design docs, hardware/firmware and licences for LED control tools (mLED Master Suite).
- Titan Intech gains exclusive Indian manufacturing rights and non-exclusive global R&D rights to export India-engineered display solutions under *TitanView* and *TitanPro*, aligning with *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.

items.title: ABB India and Deloitte alliance for AI-enabled manufacturing
items.summary:
- The alliance will embed digital intelligence across value chains to enable *connected operations* and *informed decision-making*.
- ABB India’s automation and digital platforms, including the *ABB Ability Genix* suite, will pair with Deloitte India’s transformation and cybersecurity capabilities to drive operational excellence.
- It aims to monitor real-time processes, boost productivity and energy efficiency, strengthen cyber resilience, and advance sustainability with digital safeguards.

items.title: CrisprBits raises $3M to scale CRISPR diagnostics
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *CrisprBits*, Bengaluru-based biotech startup, raised *$3 million* in a *Pre-Series A* led by *Spectrum Impact*, valuing the company at *$12 million*.
- Funds will scale the *PathCrisp* diagnostics and expand manufacturing for *human health*, *food safety*, and *animal health*, plus a *CRISPR-based strain engineering* platform for biofuels.
- CEO *Vijay Chandru* says the funding enables launches in *India* and global expansion, highlighting *synthetic biology* and AI-augmented systems.
